thread.title: High school roundup: Burnt Hills eliminated Troy in boys' soccer sectionals
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Burnt Hills eliminated Troy in boys' soccer sectionals - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Burnt Hills eliminated Troy in boys' soccer sectionals
text:
Cormac Carr had a goal and an assist as third-seeded Burnt Hills blanked No. 6 Troy 3-0 in a Section II Class A boys' soccer quarterfinal test at Burnt Hills on Saturday afternoon.
The Spartans outshot the Flying Horses 21-7 in the contest.
Burnt Hills also got goals from Kason Snyder and Oliver Cowley .
Spartan goalkeeper Alex Gigliotti had a pair of saves and Troy's Michael Rienze stopped 10 shots.
More boys' soccer: Corinth, the No. 13 seed, saw its magical ride in the Class C playoffs come to a halt. After a scoreless first half, fifth-seeded Greenville scored six times to post a 6-0 quarterfinal-round victory. The Spartans got three goals from Silas Yelich, two goals and one assist from Samuel Statham and one goal and three assists from Bryan Drossel. The Tomahawks upset fourth-seeded Mekeel Christian Academy in the preliminary round.
Girls' soccer: Sixth-seeded Maple Hill got goals from Lydia Chittenden and Lauryn Krupa to upset No. 6 Waterford 2-1 in a Class C first-round game. The Wildcats (7-9-1) will face No. 3 Lake George at Lake George on Tuesday in a quarterfinal game. The Fordians finished with a 14-3-2 mark. ... Second-seeded Burnt Hills cruised to a 3-0 victory over Gloversville in a Class A quarterfinal game. Lindsay Jameson , Kylee Babcock and Alyssa Hughes all scored goals for the Spartans. Amanda Bakyta stopped 25 shots to lead Gloversville. ... Lauryn Krupa and Lydia Chittenden scored first-half goals to lead 11th-seeded Maple Hill to a 2-1 win over sixth-seeded Waterford in a Class C first-round contest. Alexis Viola scored the lone goal for the Fordians. ... Emily South scored the game's only goal in the first half and Grace Montague stopped nine shots as 10th-seeded Galway blanked seventh-seeded Middleburgh in a Class C first-round game. The Eagles will face No. 2 Greenville at Greenville in a quarterfinal on Tuesday.
